data.title: CLL is Hosting Israeli Business Forum of NY Program Featuring Journalist and Author Ronen Bergman
data.text:
Cowan, Liebowitz & Latman is hosting an Israeli Business Forum of NY program featuring journalist and author Ronen Bergman on Thursday, February 8, 2018.

Ronen Bergman will speak about his new book Rise and Kill First. Ronen Bergman is the senior correspondent for military and intelligence affairs for Yedioth Ahronoth, Israel’s largest daily paid newspaper, and a contributing writer for The New York Times Magazine, where he reports on intelligence, national security, terrorism, and nuclear issues. Bergman is the author of five bestselling Hebrew-language nonfiction books and The Secret War with Iran, which was published in the U.S. by Free Press. Bergman is the recipient of the Sokolow Prize, Israel’s most esteemed award for journalism, and the B’nai B’rith International Press Award, among other honors. A member of the Israeli bar, he graduated with honors from the University of Haifa Faculty of Law and clerked in the attorney general’s office. A winner of a Chevening Scholarship from the British Foreign Office, he received a master’s in international relations from Cambridge University, where he was also awarded his PhD in history.

Advance registration is required. Space is limited. More information about the event and how to register is available here.

The Israeli Business Forum of New York (IBF) is an apolitical, nonprofit organization that facilitates business discussions and networking events for Israeli professionals in New York.
